page.title: 07WARKWORTH PAGEANT 1983
page.content: In{1982}an idea was formulated by the villagers to hold a{pageant}in the bailey of{Warkworth Castle}based upon the{history}of the castle. It was thought that this was an original idea until someone said that they had taken part in the{1928 Pageant.}It was then discovered that there had been about {five pageants}in the{1920s and 30s. People were needed to fill the{two- {hundred}parts so the vicar, teachers, pupils, farmers, and shopkeepers volunteered.{Costumes}were needed and everybody made their own.{Shields}were made by prisoners from{Acklington {Prison. Fight scenes}were carefully rehearsed.{Fund-raising}activities began and the whole village was involved. The{press and radio}became interested - then television. The Pageant was{a huge success}and was shown on{national BBC TV in 1984.
